text: my role is predominately working with
large enterprise customers about doing
transformation to the cloud and doing it
in a secure manner we see a lot of
challenges with companies whereby
they're taking legacy approaches and
that just doesn't work for them so I
unleash it down with customers and work
out how can they go to the cloud safely
and on a really innovate in these places
the biggest challenges that we still see
nowadays is security so it compliance
Fiat
the multitude of controls the cost
effective manner and also really trying
to combat the new zero-day threats that
are out there what excites me about the
public sector is that they are just
embarking on this journey to public
cloud it should be interesting to see
how they adopt the new services and how
they innovate the key takeaway working
with AWS is that we can jointly work
together and help customers innovate and
deliver new services in go-to-market
using the public cloud so the best
public sector reference that we have
working with AWS is NASA they have over
200,000 pages of public content and over
100 applications that they wanted to
migrate from their on-premise data
center out into the public cloud and
they needed to do this over a diverse
range of services as well they needed a
platform that would help them reduce
costs be compliant because they have to
be compliant with NIST and FedRAMP and
our deep security platform helped them
to do this in a way that was positive
active and actually allowed them to
innovate with new services as well
working with AWS we get
innovate and integrate with our newest
services allowing customers to procure
these new services and adopt new go to
market strategies for the future
